intro: Calochortus discolor, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the lily family and is characterized by its striking white, orchid-like blooms. The plant has a short, stout stem and produces small, delicate leaves that are often hidden beneath the soil. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited habitat, it is considered a rare and protected species.
